title: Decimal Operations: Addition and Subtraction

vocab.definition: A number that uses a decimal point to show parts of a whole
The dot that separates the whole number from the fractional part
The first place to the right of the decimal point
The second place to the right of the decimal point
The value of a digit based on its position in a number

teachingNotes: Emphasize aligning decimal points when adding and subtracting. Use place value charts and visual models. Connect decimals to money for real-world applications.

truefalse.question: When adding decimals, you must line up the decimal points.

fillintheblank.question: In the number 45.67, the digit 6 is in the ________ place.

wordProblems.question: Sarah bought a book for $12.75 and a pen for $3.49. How much did she spend in total?
